title: Lady Vikings upend Fayette rivals
text:
Lady Vikings upend Fayette rivals Thursday, October 08, 2015 Comments 
Northgate pitcher Brittany Trammell earned a victory against McIntosh on Wednesday Trammell and teammate Kaitlin Bailey held the Lady Chiefs and Fayette rival Starrâ€™s Mill to just two runs. 
FAYETTEVILLE - Northgate opened the Region 4- softball tournament with two big wins on Wednesday, beating Fayette County rivals McIntosh and Starr's Mill with respective 3-2 and 5-2 victories. 
Against the Lady Chiefs, Northgate built a 3-0 lead before surrendering two run to McIntosh in the fifth inning before holding off the rally the rest of the way. 
Northgate fell behind 2-1 against Starr's Mill, but rallied with four runs in the seventh inning to secure the victory. 
Leadoff hitter Morgan Runyans came up with a clutch two-run hit to give the Lady Vikings a lead for good against Starr's Mill in their final at bat. 
Pitchers Brittany Trammell and Kaitlin Bailey combined for victories over the two games, with Bailey entering the sixth inning against McIntosh to pick up a save by shutting down the Lady Chiefs after they closed the lead to within one. 
Against McIntosh, Trammell gave up four hits and struck out two, with Bailey allowing just two hits and striking out two the rest of the way. 
Bailey went the distance against Starr's Mill, allowing four hits, and striking out one. 
Offensively, the Lady Vikings pounded out 11 hits en route to the two victories, including seven in the win against McIntosh. 
Charla Echols went 3-for-4 performance and an RBI. 
Raegan Kinsch had two hits against the Lady Chiefs. Kinsch also had an RBI against Starr's Mill. 
Jessica Cochran also picked had an RBI for the Lady Vikings in the victory against Starr's Mill, which avenged a loss in the regular season. 
LADY VIKINGS 3, LADY CHIEFS 2

Northgate 102 000 X- 3 7 2

LADY VIKINGS 5, LADY PANTHERS 2
